intro: Adenocalymma grandifolium, commonly known as the broad-leafed adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
